author: Arshiya Chopra
content: The Indian Navy carried out a rescue operation after a Barbados-flagged bulk carrier MV True Confidence in Gulf of Aden was reportedly hit by a missile from Yemen's Houthi militants. "INS Kolkata deployed for Maritime Security Operations, arrived on location at 1645 hrs & rescued 21 crew, including one Indian national, using integral helicopter & boats," the Navy wrote.
title: Indian Navy saves 21 people from ship hit by Houthi missile, shares visuals

author: Kalpesh
content: Europe was waiting for the European Central Bank to lay out its latest interest rate cut plans on Thursday after the Federal Reserve had hinted at its first cut in years again and the Bank of Japan had set the yen on another tear higher.Commodity prices gyrated on the weaker dollar. Gold prices rose 0.4% to $2,156.49, another record high.
title: Europe waits on ECB as BOJ lights up the yen

author: Disha Jana
content: Pakistan's Punjab got its first Sikh minister after Ramesh Singh Arora took oath on Wednesday. Arora, a PML-N lawmaker, was elected to the provincial assembly for his third term. He hails from Narowal district and has been allotted the minorities portfolio in the cabinet. Notably, Arora had played a significant role in implementing Sikh Marriage Registration Act 2018 in Pakistan.
title: Pak's Punjab gets its 1st Sikh minister as Ramesh Arora takes oath

author: Shreyansh Jain
content: Lee Davies and his fiancee Carryann Copestick, a British couple, found themselves in a whirlwind of emotions after winning a lottery worth Rs 1 crore in 2017. But their lives took a harrowing turn soon when burglars forcibly entered their home. Armed with knives and rods, the intruders demanded the lottery winnings, leaving them in a state of shock.
title: UK couple's life turns into nightmare after Rs 1 crore jackpot

author: The Hawk Editor
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar criticized China for breaching agreements and causing the 2020 border conflict, the first in 45 years. At the Tokyo Raisina Roundtable, he discussed the Indo-Pacific's shifting powers and the implications for global stability, emphasizing the need for peace and adherence to accords for improved Sino-India relations and a stable international order.
title: Jaishankar accuses China of violating key agreements

author: Ashima Mahindra
content: A former Australian lifeguard suffered from 200 skin cancers he got as a result of not wearing sun protection. Leigh Rasschou released shocking pictures of his condition, showing his hacked-off skin, horrific wounds, and permanent disfigurement. Raaschou said he spent most of his life outside directly under the powerful glare on the beaches in Victoria.
title: Former Lifeguard Battles 200 Cancers With Hacked Skin

author: Farida
content: A viral video from Greater Noida's Gaur City 2 depicts a brutal assault on an individual at a pharmacy, sparking safety concerns. A dispute over medication escalated into violence, captured on CCTV. Social media users condemned the aggression and called for stricter enforcement. The incident highlights ongoing safety issues in Uttar Pradesh, especially in Noida.
title: Brutal Assault on Pharmacist Raises Concerns Over UP Law and Order

author: Varsha
content: Indian Navy's INS Kolkata rescued 21 crew members from MV True Confidence, hit by a Houthi missile in the Gulf of Aden. Three dead, several injured. The warship swiftly executed the rescue, providing medical aid. The crew was airlifted to Djibouti. The incident adds to concerns about Red Sea attacks.
title: Indian Navy Saves 21 After Houthi Missile Attack

author: Jay Pandya
content: An outbreak of psittacosis, commonly known as 'parrot fever', has affected several people across the European Union and claimed five lives, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has stated. Several cases of bacterial infection were reported in 2023 and at the beginning of 2024. WHO said there was a surge in the number of cases during November-December 2023.
title: Five dead from 'parrot fever' in Europe; Check details here

author: Pravesh Maurya
content: There are currently 10 VFS offices available for travelers in India. Its expansion has been planned in the coming year. One of the key features of this initiative is the introduction of the Stopover Programme. Under this program, Saudi Airlines or private Saudi low cost airline is providing 96 hours free visa to the individuals traveling through Flynas.
title: Saudi Arabia offering 96 hour stopover visa to Indian travellers
